title: Donald Trump 'would love to have Michael Bloomberg run' â as it happened | US news | The Guardian
summary: trump : i would love bloomberg competition .
clinton defends speeches to big banks .

text: we 're wrapping up today 's live coverage of all things 2016 , so a summary of what has been said ( a lot ) and done ( not a lot ) is in order¦ jeb bush praised the embattled republican governor of michigan , rick snyder , for the way he has handled a toxic water crisis that authorities have known about for more than a year .

i admire rick synder for stepping up right now , the former florida governor said , before blaming the lead-poisoned water of flint on outdated regulation systems , rather than the state officials who decided the city should draw from the polluted river .
donald trump welcomed michael bloomberg into the race should the former mayor of new york want in .
michael has been a friend of mine over the years , the republican frontrunner said .
i do n't know if we 're friends anymore , frankly .
but michael has been a friend of mine .
i would love to have michael bloomberg run .
i would love that competition .
trump 's top strategist faces his biggest test in iowa this week , where there 's only a week left before the republican caucuses .
ben jacobs reported on the mystery of trump 's ground game .
hillary clinton defended the high-paying speeches she gave on wall street after stepping down as secretary of state .

she also said she was tough on financial firms when she was a senator in 2006 , an argument undermined somewhat by consideration of the wall street malfeasances that contributed to the economy 's collapse two years later .
bernie sanders avoided offering an answer about why he does not support reparations for slavery , a question that other candidates have not yet publicly answered .
he said the us should invest in education and criminal justice reform to help african americans .
my colleague richard wolffe felt the bern in iowa , where voters are getting to like the vermont senator .
and finally , jill abramson , former executive editor of the new york times , asked : can clinton win young women , or have the gaps between generations ( and waves of feminism ) grown too large ?
in new hampshire , meanwhile , opinion editor megan carpentier met with women who want to hear a dream .
'hillary , can you excite us ?
' : the trouble with clinton and young women | jill abramson read more
i am a half-breed .
i 'm always getting a half-breed .
so declared katrina pierson on sunday , when the national spokesperson for donald trump 's presidential campaign appeared on cnn 's reliable sources .

trump 's eccentric spokesperson was asked by host brian stelter about a comment she made about barack obama and mitt romney back in 2012 , and which author jk rowling derided on sunday through an allusion to the villains of her harry potter series .
stelter asked if she would like to take back this tweet : katrina pierson ( @ katrinapierson ) perfect obama 's dad born in africa , mitt romney 's dad born in mexico .
any pure breeds left ?
# cnndebate but like her boss , pierson enjoys a solidly outrageous statement , whether it 's made in words or a necklace made of bullets .
she does n't regret the tweet at all : look , these tweets , i 'm an activist .
and i am a half-breed .
i 'm always getting a half breed .
and on twitter , when you 're fighting with liberals and even establishment , you go back at the same silliness they 're giving you .
so , i myself am a half-breed .
stelter did n't quite know what to make of the silliness , but pierson kept going .
she said that dredging up what she or trump may have said in the past was just the futile resistance of a hapless few who can not accept their love of trump : we have entered silly season .
donald trump is up in the polls again .
there 's desperate campaigns out there .
they ca n't take him down so they try to take down the people that are around him .
and we 're just not going to get distracted by all that nonsense .

ben jacobs ( @ bencjacobs ) national spokesperson for donald trump : `` gay is not normal , accept that '' stelter did n't mention a 2012 tweet by pierson that expressed intolerance for gay people , nor a 2011 one in which she doubted how much jesus christ had to do with founding catholicism , nor a recent one in which she blamed muslims for the crusades .
it would be understandable if he was overwhelmed by that first one alone .
twitter or at least one of its many denizens , in this case a guardian uk type has spoken : russell cunningham ( @ cunninghamshire ) the seinfeld reboot looks rubbish .

here 's a thing : close on five years ago , in the middle of the original birther furore over barack obama 's qualification to be president , jerry seinfeld and donald trump became involved in a bit of a contretemps .
seinfeld , you see , called donald trump god 's gift to comedy and also said : if god gave comedians the power to invent people , the first person we would invent is donald trump .

the donald , meanwhile , had a pop at seinfeld over one of his post-seinfeld non-seinfeld projects , writing : what i do feel badly about is that i agreed to do , and did , your failed show the marriage ref , even though i thought it was absolutely terrible .
so that 's nice .

this just in from reuters¦ the us house of representatives will not vote on legislation on tuesday and wednesday because of the severe winter storm that hit the country 's capital city over the weekend , according to majority leader kevin mccarthy 's office .
the next vote by the congressional chamber is expected on 1 february .
¦so that would be no voting on two days this week because of a storm which hit the capital , and indeed the capitol , three days before the first of those two now voteless days .
if you follow .
it 's not as if congress gets much done these days anyway , of course .
although maybe , as ben jacobs writes , it actually does .

¦and that 's that for the talk shows , which the mighty alan yuhas watched and blogged so you did n't have to , which as jobs goes is a bit like being the guy i saw driving a bobcat in the driveway of a swanky manhattan co-op yesterday .
you drive , you sweat , you work and work and work¦ and still the snow keeps coming .
anyway .
one smorgasbord dealt with , here 's another .

on the guardian today , as well as the he said , she said , we said , you said , we all said while screaming for mercy if not ice cream back and forth of the shows , we have the following politics fare : new columnist jill abramson asks if hillary clinton can do more to gain the support of young women .
richard wolffe writes from the aptly named town of clinton , iowa , where hillary and bernie both pitched up on saturday .
lucia graves attempts to choose her own rich-white-new-yorker for president , in light of the reportedly impending game-changing bloomberg gambit .
ben jacobs is on the ground in iowa , looking at the trump campaign 's ground game in the state .
and¦ and¦ ed pilkington looks at a new threat to voting rights protections in north carolina .
in the east , at least , that should keep you reading while other people get on with clearing the snow .

documents.title: trump : i would love bloomberg competition
text: and finally , donald trump has phoned in to meet the press , too .
he starts going off on senator ted cruz , his closest rival in iowa , almost immediately .
i am a conservative .
but i get along with people .
ted can not get along with people at all , he says .
i mean , the biggest problem he has , he 's a nasty guy and nobody likes him .
not one republican senator , he works with them every day , not one republican senator has endorsed ted cruz .

no republican senators have endorsed trump , either , though one popular , six-term iowa senator did show up at a trump rally on saturday , and even used the billionaire 's slogan make america great again .
trump then runs through his breakup with cruz , who was chummy toward the donald right until he caught up with him in the polls .
look , he was very nice to me , and i kept saying , when is it going to happen , ted ?
when is it going to happen ? '
i was waiting , because i wanted counterparts .
i do n't want to be the first one .
and then during the debate , a debate which everyone said i won , he got very nasty .
and he started hitting me and i hit him back .
and then , you know , since then .
but i was saying , he was following along , anything i said was ok to him .
anything i said .
and he was really , you know , look , i had some people that have been terrific on the stand .
and i like some of the candidates very much on a personal basis .
but ted was very nice .
and then i said , and during that period of time , i said , come on , ted , when is it going to happen ? '
because i understand ted .
ted 's a nasty guy , who is not a very well-liked person .
as for cruz 's accusations that trump is not a real conservative , trump has two words : ronald and reagan .
he was a somewhat liberal democrat , and over the years , he evolved and he became fairly conservative .
not overly , a fairly conservative republican .
trump flips the attack around on cruz : ted cruz was absolutely weak on immigration and then all of a sudden he got stronger .
he adds a line about how he does n't know if the texas senator ( born a dual canadian-american citizen ) is eligible for president .
trump also promises he will release his tax returns but he wo n't say when .
rest assured , though , i have very big returns and i have everything all approved and very beautiful .
he wishes politicians would n't give his tax money to iraq .
united states of new york : bloomberg 2016 talk keeps focus on big apple read more as for bloomberg , trump is all for it .
michael has been a friend of mine over the years , i do n't know if we 're friends anymore , frankly .
but michael has been a friend of mine .
i would love to have michael bloomberg run .
i would love that competition .
bernie sanders is also on the nbc talk show , and talking about how much he would love to take on donald trump in the general election .
i would very much look forward to a race against donald trump , a guy who does n't want to raise the minimum wage but wants to give hundreds of billions of dollars to the top [ 1 ] percent .
there is nothing in this world that i would like more than to face donald trump .
we would beat him and we would beat him badly .
sanders says what is unique about this race are the dichotomies appearing : not just a political establishment but also the financial interests in this country , and corporate establishment .
chuck todd asks sanders why he would n't support reparations for slavery , an idea raised by writer ta-nehisi coates in a 2014 essay .
sanders dodges , or , if your being generous , elides .
he says he does not support reparations for the same reason that barack obama and for the same reason i believe hillary clinton has .

he talks about the need to invest in young people and to take on poverty , especially in african american communities , and especially in improving education and reforming the criminal justice system .
we have got to invest in the future .
we have got to address poverty ¦ i think our candidacy is the candidacy talking to the issues of the african american community .
the clinton campaign has not yet responded to questions from the guardian about her position on reparations .

pressed on the question of some of his more ambitious proposals , he again elides , saying that he believes some of his ideas are possible because of the sheer number of voters who he thinks have been marginalized in the electorate .
that is why billionaires are able to buy elections , he says .
but with young people , minorities and others , he says , we can raise the minimum wage , we can create jobs .
finally , sanders gets the bloomberg question of the day .
well , my reaction is if donald trump wins and mr blomberg gets in .
you 're going to have multibillionaires running for president of the united states .
i do n't think the american people want to see the [ us ] move toward an oligarchy .

documents.title: clinton defends speeches to big banks
text: hillary clinton is on nbc 's meet the press , where chuck todd throws her a softball : what would be your biggest priority as president ?
there are several really important issues , healthcare being one of them , she says .
i 've met a man on friday who can no longer afford to pay for his hiv medication , she says , and a woman whose prescription costs went from a few hundred to into the thousands .
that really hits my heart , i know what people are going through .
she says she would work to lower prices and cap those prescription drug companies .
plus she wants to fix the job system , get more jobs .
it 's very stumpy .
todd asks a more pointed question : how come you took millions in speaking fees from banks ?
i gave speeches to a wide array of groups , from healthcare groups to auto dealers and many many more ¦ what they were interested in ¦ was the world .
coming off of four years as secretary of state in a complicated world ¦ people were interested in what i saw , what i thought .
there was a lot of interest in the bin laden raid , she says .
americans who are doing business in avery aspect of the economy want to know more about the world .
so no conflict of interest with the banks ?
absolutely not .
i took them on when i was senator .
she says she took on mortgage and investment firms back in 2006 ¦ and then she says that as president she will make sure those same firms no longer can wreck our economy the way they did in 2008 .
finally , clinton says the former new york mayor michael bloomberg who is reportedly thinking about getting in the race is a good friend of mine .
but she wo n't talk about the hypothetical of his candidacy .
i 'm going to do the best i can to make sure that i get the nomination and we 'll go from there , she says .
the camera turns to florida senator marco rubio , the republican candidate du jour on fox news sunday .
host chris wallace asks rubio about his hot new endorsement from the des moines register , the influential iowa newspaper .
rubio says it 's all part of the plan .
this is the momentum we need .
he gets upset when wallace suggests rubio does n't seem to have so much momentum in the polls , where he 's hovering around third and shows little hope of winning the early states .

this is along slog because there 's a number of people running , rubio says , calling the race an unusual primary he brags : we have more ads on television than any candidate in iowa and new hampshire and south carolina .
those ads are shorter , is all .
we 're always looking to save money .

rubio turns most of the interview into a stump speech about defeating hillary clinton , though wallace manages to prod him about whether he 's more of a mainstream candidate unpopular types at the moment or more of the rogue/rabble-rouser type beloved by some conservatives .
most of the establishment said to me , you have to wait , you ca n't run , ' rubio says .
he argues that it 's big money from the establishment that 's targeting him in negative ads .

to show off his outsider bona fides he says he 's the only candidate who 's ever done anything against obamacare , not a speech but i actually achieved something ¦ we got rid of the bailout fund , which may very well result in the collapse of obamacare .
wallace points out that he 's basically making this up .
well , they 're wrong , says rubio .
he changes the subject : ted cruz 's tax plans .
wallace changes the subject again : how about those bloomberg-for-president rumors ?
i do n't agree on his stance on the second amendment and other issues , rubio says .
if he decides to be come a candidate i 'll engage .
tina fey returned to saturday night live as sarah palin and it was¦ ¦emotional .
announcing that she was taking a break from her full-time career writing things on facebook , fey 's palin endorsed darrell hammond 's trump .

and , mere days after palin-palin entered the fray in 2016 with a speech for the ages assuming mankind in its entirety gets to spend those ages in a padded room surrounded by bright , edgeless objects and soothing music among those who will never forget fey-palin 's impact on the 2008 presidential election ¦ there was much rejoicing .
so many of us have lost our jobs at the factories or on reality shows about alaska , fey-palin began , in her appeal to a suffering america .
or seen our own children targeted by the police for no reason other than that they committed some crimes .
reference points : see here , and here .
fey-palin then gave her version of the holy rollers , rock and rollers part of palin 's speech in support of trump last week .
she 's crazy , is n't she , hammond-trump said , to camera .
and that seemed to be the theme for the cold open : snl considers palin two corinthians short of a bible .
it 's not biting satire , is it ?
fey-palin 's conclusion , thus : guess what , america , i do n't really think this guy should be president .
i 'm just here 'cause he 's promised me a spot in his cabinet .
and i belong in a cabinet 'cause i 'm full of s and i 've got a great rack .
snl writers room haunted by the ghost of benny hill ?
it would be a headline , at least .
apocalypse now : sarah palin 's bizarre trump endorsement analyzed read more
this just in while simultaneously coming down the track this morning , thanks to the miracle that is politico 's playbook email , which has excerpted it .
on thursday , donald trump spoke to howard kurtz , host of fox news ' media buzz .
the conversation goes out at 11am et today .
according to the politico excerpt , trump was asked about african american voters and his appeal to them .
he said : they are going to like me better than they like obama .
the truth is obama has done nothing for them .
kurtz attempted to interject , saying wait¦ but trump continued : he 's african american .
he 's done nothing for them .
kurtz managed to interject , asking : did you just say african americans are going to like you better than the first african american president ?

to which trump said : i think that relatively speaking i mean , he does have a slight advantage , in all fairness but i think relatively speaking , when i am finished , i think they will absolutely love donald trump .
kurtz then asked trump if he would tone down your rhetoric and reach out to minorities more if he gained the republican nomination .
trump said : oh , absolutely .
there you have it .
the anti-immigrant rhetoric , the anti-muslim rhetoric¦ is just a means to an end .
he says .

documents.title: bush : 'i admire rick snyder '
text: next on the carousel is former florida governor jeb bush , who looks sad to be here in this interview with cnn 's jake tapper .
i hope to be the nominee , he says , perhaps unnecessarily in context .
i think donald trump would be a disaster as the nominee because he 's a conservative .
ted cruz is certainly a conservative but he does n't have a proven record .
bush is fifth in the aggregate of national polls , below retired neurosurgeon and pyramid truther ben carson , with around 5 % .
his losing for now is just part of the process , he says .
we need to let the process work ¦ this will sort itself out ¦ i feel good about where we are .
the reason donald trump does well is there 's a perception of strength ¦ it 's not strong to insult women .
it 's not strong to insult hispanics .
he adds that it 's not strong to insult prisoners of war or the disabled ( trump went after senator john mccain and a reporter with a disability last year ) .
he 's not the strong horse , bush says .
he 's insecure .
he 's weak .
bush argues that he does n't need to be popular to win a national election .
hey , his brother did it .
that 's the problem with chasing popularity , because it changes .
tapper asks about the possibility of a bloomberg candidacy , again .
bush says it 's not gon na happen .
mike bloomberg is a good man .
we disagree on a whole lot of things but he 's a good person , he 's a patriot .

united states of new york : bloomberg 2016 talk keeps focus on big apple read more bush says he just wants to be the conservative candidate of choice and ca n't do much about the other guys competing with him for the job .
i ca n't follow all of this stuff , he says , perhaps too honestly .
this is how politics works .
this is pretty tame compared to previous elections .
i ca n't control what i ca n't control .
finally tapper asks about the crisis involving lead-poisoned water in flint , michigan .
emails show that republican governor rick snyder ignored and dismissed the problem more than a year ago , even as children began showing signs of irreparable lead poisoning .
bush says we should probably blame big government .
i admire rick snyder for stepping up , bush says .
he likes that snyder has fired people , accepted responsiblitiy for trying to fix this .
he does n't like that city and state and federal officials were n't talking more , and blames 20th-century regulation in a 21st-century world .

first up on the morning talk shows is governor chris christie , who tells cnn 's jake tapper that he did a dandy job managing the snowstorm in new jersey , nothing to fear from icy flooding in coastal cities here .
then they talk politics .
tapper asks christie why should americans elect him president when the governor has a 31 % approval rating from new jerseyans , his lowest ever .
that 's only because he 's running for president , christie says .
when you start looking for another job your current employer gets a little miffed .
but i think they saw yesterday what strong effective leadership can do in the midst of a crisis .
he says that his rating has been as a high as 75 % and every place in between .
i do n't govern for approval ratings i govern for results ¦ when the chips are down i deliver .
tapper asks about the possibility of a bloomberg candidacy .
christie says he ca n't judge until the former mayor hits the relentless nature of the campaign trail .
that tells you a lot about what kind of person the president will be ¦ when you 're not a candidate you do n't deserve to be evaluated as whether you 'd make a good president or not .
but was he a good mayor ?
oh yeah , he was a good mayor , sure .
how about your rival , senator marco rubio ?
not so much .
rubio has never been responsible for anything ¦ i do n't expect senator rubio to understand that because he 's never had to make a decision of any consequence .
he says that life as a us senator reminds him of a school in which everyone does as they 've been told .
but do n't misunderstand this as being negative about anybody , christie says .
governor kasich has been negative , senator rubio has been relentlessly negative ¦ mr trump has been negative .
we 're simply not going to engage in that game .
we will punch back if we feel like we need to but we 're certainly not going to initiate that kind of thing ¦ i think we 're doing just fine .
hello and welcome to our live coverage of the 2016 race for the white house .
today 's abbreviated , sunday edition of the politics blog will take in the talk shows so you do n't have to , plus the highs and lows of a weekend on the trail .

here 's what 's happened over the weekend : billionaire donald trump leads republican polls nationally , 37.4 % to ted cruz 's 17.4 % , and in new hampshire and iowa , though only by a two points over cruz in the latter state .
with only two weeks left before iowans caucus in the first decision of the primary election , most of the candidates are in the hawkeye state .
speaking of ¦ an influential iowa newspaper , the des moines register , has endorsed republican senator marco rubio and democratic frontrunner hillary clinton in the respective primary elections .
rubio is at 12.8 % in aggregated polls there .
i could stand in the middle of fifth avenue and shoot somebody and i would n't lose any voters , trump told iowans on saturday .
he also had a popular and mainstream republican !
senator in the audience , though not that senator 's endorsement .
clinton hit the road in new hampshire , where she tried to channel past victories for her present struggle with vermont senator bernie sanders .
he leads her 50.7 % to 41.9 % there , though he trails nationally , 52.6 % to 36.3 % .
but clinton has plenty of fans ¦ some of whom wish she 'd give them a bit more of a vision .

sanders is closer to clinton in iowa , and my colleague david smith notes that the bern phenomenon is n't so dissimilar from the revolt among conservatives that has lifted trump to the top of the polls .
and we may get an another candidate of neither party !
sources close to former new york mayor michael bloomberg reported that the billionaire yes , another billionaire is thinking he might jump in the race as an independent candidate .
( no third-party candidate has ever won . )
finally , if you 're hungry for nostalgia/schadenfreude , take a break to recall the rise and fall of sarah palin , linked below .
the rise and fall of sarah palin : plucked away from alaska , she lost her soul read more

Clinton rejects banks criticism; Tina Fey returns to SNL as Sarah Palin.
Jill Abramson: the trouble with Hillary Clinton and young women.
Lucia Graves: Bloomberg offers Choose-Your-Own-New-Yorker election.
